intro: Heterotheca hispida, commonly known as roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Heterotheca hispida is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
